basic.shortDescription: Slice through ice and lava to clear the mammoth’s path! We’ve teamed up with university education experts to craft an incredibly fun way to explore important fractions concepts. Discover the school version of this popular award-winning game!
basic.description: Slice Fractions: School Edition by Ululab

developer.name: Ululab
developer.description:
Slice Fractions: School Edition is a fun problem solving game that guides students to intuitively and effectively learn fractions through critical concepts. In this puzzling world, players must slice the right amount of ice and lava to clear the mammoth’s path.

The game is the fruit of multiple years of research and development by Ululab with the help of math learning experts from the University of Quebec in Montreal (UQAM). It has a smooth progression designed for kids who are new to fractions or who have not yet understood its basic concepts. The environment is free of written instructions, which lets students dive into math reasoning without being obstructed by their literacy level.

curriculum: Addresses critical concepts, such as Part-whole partitioning, Numerator / Denominator notation, Fraction equivalence, Fraction ordering and Fraction subtraction.
Triggers specific common math misconceptions and causes players to reconsider what they thought they knew about fractions.
Students will let go of their fear of fractions and will instead gain interest in their complexity.

UQAM professors are now performing a complete study in 2015 to understand how Slice Fractions changes students’ comprehension of important fractions concepts. The results will be posted here, so stay tuned!

list.review: Combine “Cut the Rope” style problem solving with a side scrolling venue that gets progressively harder, and you get the idea of Slice Fractions — an app that gently introduces some deep mathematical ideas, like equivalency, part-whole partitioning and numerator/denominator notation. Solving each level requires some higher order 2 and 3 step logical problem solving.

This app uses slicing mechanics similar to that of the mega-popular puzzler Cut the Rope, so you know kids will like to play it. The result is an engaging physics puzzler that feels like a game but which also hones kids' math skills in working with fractions.

Slice Fractions does a really great job of teaching without making it feel like a lesson, though it also dynamically gives hints if it senses you're stuck. The controls are straightforward and easy to use.

I am a special education teacher and I was looking for a fractions app for my students. This app is fabulous. I just finished playing it and wow it made me think. It is a combination of physics and fractions most appropriate for fourth or fifth grade students. I cannot wait to have my students try it.

Intelligent and well-designed application. Ideal to discover the step by step fraction concepts. Incorporates notions of physics and angles discreetly. Great graphics and sounds qualities. Kudos to the designers and educators who created this application!

I have been using this app as an added resource for teaching fractions to my special education students! It was so much fun they didn't even realize they were doing math! It is great for identifying, simplifying, adding, and subtracting fractions. Hope they add more levels soon!!
This game is amazing. I am a maths tutor and I've recommended it to all my clients. One boy I tutor is hooked on it. I will be looking out for other games by this developer
